text: Juan Cristobal Tapia de Veer also known as Cristo, is a Chilean-born Canadian movie and television score composer, arranger, producer and multi- instrumentalist based in Montreal, QC, Canada. He is mostly known for his music to the British 6-part drama UTOPIA for which he won an RTS Craft Award in the best original score category in 2013. == Early life == Cristo was born during the military coup d'état in Chile. First, his parents fled to Paris, France. While his father decided to stay there, his mother took him back to Chile. Life under Pinochet's dictatorship still proved impossible, so they found political refuge in Québec, Canada.short bio of Productions Multi-Monde, 2009, http://pmm.qc.ca/eldorado/en/team.php == Career == He obtained a master's degree in Classical Music (specialization in percussion) from the Conservatoire de musique du Québec. In 2001 he got signed to Warner Music with his pop-band One Ton, putting a hold on his classical career. The trio won the Canadian Dance Music Award (SOCAN) in 2003 with the electro-dance single "Supersex World".Chartattack http://www.chartattack.com/news/2003/11/25/sam- roberts-tom-cochrane-avril-lavigne-shine-at-socan-awards/ It was Cristo who produced the album.biography of Free Run Artists Agency, 2013, http://www.freerunartists.com/artists.html == Movie & TV scoring == In 2011, his music for the Victorian 4-part drama The Crimson Petal and the White (dir: Marc Munden, BBC2) totally surprised the audiences. Matthew Gilbert, The Boston Globe, U.S.: "The soundtrack ranges from gnawing electronic hums to choral ecstasy. It's all brilliantly, effectively, appropriately jarring, even if it sends the Masterpiece crowd to the medicine cabinet for Dramamine."Matthew Gilbert, The Boston Globe, 09.09.2012, http://www.boston.com/ae/tv/2012/09/09/the-crimson-petal-and-the-white- revisiting-victorian-times-with-rated-twist/AvdrcuWBUG0bVlAJPdTVsL/story.html His latest work is in the conspiracy thriller UTOPIA created by Dennis Kelly, that aired on Channel 4. A second series has already been commissioned. The Royal Television Society awarded him a Craft & Design Awards for "best original music" in November 2013.RTS Craft & Design Awards nomination list http://www.rts.org.uk/rts-craft-design-awards He wrote music for a new TV- show called Série Noire, written and directed by the writers of "Les Invincibles", released in January 2014 on Radio-Canada.Radio-Canada TV http://serienoire.radio-canada.ca/tournage ==References== == Other websites == * *Cristobal Tapia de Veer on soundcloud Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:Multi-instrumentalists Category:Canadian composers Category:Musicians from Santiago
